title: Manaton Walks

images.title: Cottages and St Winifred's Church, Manaton by Vieve Forward, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cottages and St Winifred's Church, Manaton. The 15th-century church, located in a prominent spot due north of the village green, is dedicated to St Winifred. Three of the six bells in its tower are medieval – markings on the oldest indicate that it dates back to around 1440–1450, making them at least as ancient as the tower. They are still being rung today on a regular basis by the local team of bellringers.

images.title: The archway, Manaton Gate by David Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Mark A Coleman, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bowerman's Nose

description: This pretty Dartmoor village is a lovely place to start a walk. It's located close to several of the National Park's highlights and has a fine pub to relax in after your exercise. This circular walk from the village visits the splendid Lustleigh Cleave, the popular Becky Falls and the fascinating stone stack at Bowerman's Nose. There's much to enjoy with peaceful woodland trails, riverside paths along the River Bovey, stunning waterfalls and fabulous views over the national park from the high points. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Manaton. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy refreshments at the Kestor. They serve good quality dishes and have a nice garden to sit out in. The pub is dog friendly and located at postcode TQ13 9UF.

display_address: Langstone, Manaton, Water, Teignbridge, Devon, England, TQ13 9UJ, United Kingdom
